column1: non-turning short ball outside off, Lewis stands tall and forces the ball straight to cover
much fuller and sliding away outside off, scythed away to point, who dives to his left and deflects the ball to cover-point
in-ducker from Imad, drifts in, takes the inside edge and rolls behind square as Walton plays down the wrong line
full on off, opens the bat-face and glides the ball to point
full, stump-to-stump line, pushed past the right of the bowler
dragged short on off, forced on the back foot to the left of the bowler
full and sliding down leg, wide
skids on just outside leg, deflected fine on the leg side. Lewis exposed his leg stump and simply attempted a glance
non-turning offbreak, full on middle, driven with a straight bat  to long-on who is in the deep
drift now for Hafeez. Short and darts back in, cramps the left-hander for room. Kept out
Boom! Dropped short and outside off, Lewis is super quick to pick up the length. Rocks back and pulls it with immense authority over midwicket. Good use of the crease
fast dart on the stumps, bunted towards midwicket
short and outside off, skips back and chops the ball straight to cover

Shehzad swoops down on the ball and nails a direct hit at the striker's end. Lewis is caught short on the second. This is fractionally short and middle and leg, the batsman goes on the back foot and punches it through midwicket. Shehzad tears to his left from wide long-on, collects the ball with just one hand, and fires a flat, accurate throw. Excellent reflexes from Shehzad. He leaps, pumps his fist, and celebrates animatedly
non-turner on off, played back to the bowler
pitched up on off, dinked into the covers for one
dug short on off, cramps him for room. Punched back to the bowler
slides on outside off, there are two men behind point, but still Walton finds the gap. Precise placement. Leans back and late-cuts it deftly as the ball skips away to the boundary
pretty full and strikes the pad as Samuels plays back. But this has pitched outside leg with Samuels falling over flick
short on leg stump, worked towards midwicket on the back foot
good length and angling across off, tip and run to cover. Smart running
Samuels slinks away outside leg, this is on a length and swerving away wide outside off with the angle. Swish and a miss
good length, Tanvir rolls his fingers across this cutter. Grips in the surface and beats Samuels with extra bounce
dug in short and angling across off, Samuels stands up tall and crisply punches the ball to cover
very full and angling in, Walton eyes up a big cover drive and only manages an inside edge onto the pad
really full and outside off, driven on the up to mid-off. Kamran, the comeback man, collects the ball and flings it to the bowler. Wahab hugs Kamran and has a laugh with him
length ball on middle and leg, Walton picks it up and lofts it beautifully over midwicket. Holds his pose and makes the shot look even better
141ks, sharp, short ball just outside off, beats Walton for pace now. He sends a top-edge fluttering in front of mid-on
shortish and on the hips, picked off to the right of deep square leg. Fine leg is inside the circle
full on off, tight line, pushed back to the bowler
leg-stump ball, that is asking for trouble with fine leg inside the circle. Samuels camps back and glances it away fine of that fielder. Duly put away
slower offcutter, hoodwinks Samuels, poked back to the bowler
Samuels steps away outside the leg stump, this is heading towards leg stump, Samuels loses his balance and manages to squirt it to point via a soft outside edge
slower-ball bouncer on leg stump, 118ks, Samuels has his eyes locked on it and ducks under it safely. One for the over, says umpire Wilson
another full slower cutter on middle, dabbed to leg adjacent to the pitch
shuffles across off and works a full ball through square leg
tossed up really full and outside off, no turn, thrashed down to long-on. Powerful drive
down the track, Imad drags his length back on off stump, pushed back to the bowler

an appeal for lbw, umpire Brathwaite raises his finger and sends back Samuels. Non-turning arm-ball. Samuels uses his feet and plays across the line. Imad fires it flatter and faster. Pings the back pad in front of middle. It would have missed leg? Yep, the tracker suggests it would head past the leg stump
full and outside off, forward and driven to sweeper cover
full on the stumps, driven through midwicket
full on off, defended on the front foot to cover
top-spinner outside off, short, chopped to short third man

Shadab takes a wicket off his second ball on debut! This one turns in - the wrong'un. Starts outside off and comes back in, Walton was looking for the legbreak, he plays down the wrong line and is pinned in front of middle. The tracker shows this would have grazed leg, pointing to umpire's call
Pollard uses his feet and drives a full ball to leg for one

what a debut for Shadab! Poor shot from Simmons, though. He simply drags it back onto the stumps. Normal legbreak outside off, Simmons looks to sweep against the turn. Sweep across the line. Sweeps with his head looking away. That was how bad it was. Simmons only drags it back on via a bottom edge
full and outside off, presses forward, opens the face and dabs to point
googly, curves away outside off, beats the outside edge. Two wickets in his first over in international cricket
141ks, short and just outside leg, Pollard lets it pass. Leg-side wide
back of a length and outside off, punched into the covers
short of a length and outside off, stands tall and forces the ball to cover
banged short and outside off again, hit to cover again
short on leg stump, cramps Pollard for room. Sits back and fends to leg
big bouncer outside off, flies off the surface, and sails over to the keeper. Too high and the square leg umpire calls it a wide
short of a length and outside off, Narine leans back and cuts it to the right of deep point. Capably played. Narine can bat, he, in fact, opened at the Big Bash League
90mph/140kph, short ball, climbs over the stumps, beats the pull. The caught behind appeal is shot down
tossed-up googly, goes away outside off, swish and a miss

Shadab's debut is getting better! Three wickets in eight balls for him. Narine holes out to long-on. WI five down inside 10 overs. Another wrong'un, goes away outside off, Narine drops to one knee for a slog-sweep and ends up skying a catch to Imad
flighted full on off, blocked to cover
pushed down the ground
turn and bounce. Normal legbreak, hangs back and dabs it past lone slip
wrong'un to the right-hander. But the length is short. Pollard picks it off the surface and works it to square leg
back of a length and slanted in from over the wicket, Pollard plays across the line, topples over and is hit on the thigh
short inducker, Pollard plays across the line again, flicks the pad and rolls fine on off
tapped back down the pitch
just short of a good length and outside off, Powell shifts his balance onto the back foot and sends it to the wide long-on fence with a powerful pull
trapped plumb in front. This the slower offcutter from Hasan, nips back in and hits the pad in front of middle and leg. Powell had no clue about it, playing across the line so early and missing it
full and outside off, Carlos pushes loosely and inside-edges it onto the pad
straight ball on off, Pollard stretches forward and smothers it

Dropped! Kamran shells it at backward point. Why is he fielding at backward point? Shadab could have had 4 for 3. Tossed-up legbreak, turns away just outside off, Pollard swishes and skews it to the right of Kamran. He was painfully slow to react. Dives late to his right but can't close his fingers around the ball. It pops out. It looks ugly. Pakistan could have had Babar, Shehzad or Malik at backward point
faster and shorter, played back
chopped away to the right of Kamran. This time he collects the ball cleanly
slider on middle, defended
Brathwaite comes down the track and drives to long-on
short on the hips, clipped to long leg on the back foot

banged in short and outside off, Pollard fetches it from there and flat-bats a pull to the left of deep midwicket. Imad runs to his left and makes a decent save. Or not. Replays show his back foot is in contact with the ad board while collecting the ball
short and angling across off, flies past the outside edge
chest-high short ball on middle and leg, fended to short fine leg
another chest-high short ball, Carlos jumps off the ground and fends in front of midwicket for one
the short-ball barrage continues. Pollard carefully ducks under this
starts on off and rips away outside off, past the outside edge
really full on off, whipped away with the wrists to wide long-on
slider, comes in on off, Pollard plays back and blocks it
looped up outside off, turns and dips, Pollard mows and misses. But drags his back foot back in time
really full on middle and leg, faster, no turn, laced down to long-on
legbreak outside off, Carlos shuffles across off and is pinned on the pad.
short on the leg stump, Pollard pulls and misses. Rapped on the thigh
dug short and outside off, shovel-pulled over midwicket
short, Pollard inside-edges it onto the thigh
short ball on off, splices a pull to long-on
back of a length and angling across off, glided down to third man
Pollard dashes down the track, meets an off-stump full-toss and hacks it to long-on. Front-foot no-ball
wide yorker, very wide outside off, beats the flash. The umpire calls it a wide
slower cutter outside off, misses out on the free hit, as he swishes and does not connect
Pollard shimmies out, eyes up the leg side. Gets a short ball and wears it on the front thigh
just short of a good length and outside off, Pollard looks to hit it straighter, ends up carving over cover-point
Carlos now comes down the track, flays at the ball, and sends an outside edge down to deep third man
short on leg stump, backs away and forces the ball to cover
banged in short, Carlos lays into hit, flat-batting a pull on the front foot, towards deep midwicket

length ball on off, right in the slot, Carlos presses forward and swings at . Shehzad runs to his right from wide long-on, takes a swirling catch.... but realises he is about to lose his balance and tumble over the boundary. So, he flicks the ball back into the field of play and saves four runs for his team
Pakistan continue to pepper Pollard with short balls. He has been bounced out now. Banged outside off, Pollard has to fetch the pull from there. He ends up top-edging a catch to deep square leg
short of a length and angling away, the ball hits the bat as opposed to bat hitting ball. Played to point

Flat-batted smash! Carlos makes room outside leg and shimmies out. This is a head-high short ball angling away around off or a shade outside off. He reaches out and tennis-swings it straight down the ground
off-stump yorker, dug back down the pitch
full and really wide outside off, holds its line, Carlos slogs and does not connect
smashed again, this time all along the ground. Full-toss outside off, Carlos crunches a drive through the covers
down the track and hit to mid-off
scythed away to deep point
wide yorker, he can't carve it down to third man
very full on off, nearly a yorker, flat-batted to mid-off
short and outside off, beats the hook, possibly a slower ball
hip-high slower short ball, helped away very fine of short fine leg for four
full and outside off, from over the wicket, Carlos ventures across off and laps it square enough of short fine leg. Fine leg is inside the ring
Carlos has slogged the hell out of that. Back of a length ball on off, he clears his front leg and launches it over midwicket
good response from Wahab. Yorker, angling away outside off, Carlos can't slice it away
length and outside off, crunched to long-off on the front foot
shuffles across off and skews a drive through the covers
full and tailing away outside off, squeezed down to third man
slower ball cutting across off, Holder lunges out, swishes and does not connect.
another slower cutter on leg stump, this is short, Holder camps back and pulls it away to deep square leg

Gee, what was that? Carlos pre-meditates - switches into a left-hander even before Tanvir delivers the ball. Tanvir was smart enough to push it well outside leg or outside off (for a left-hander). This cutter is squirted away off the toe end
the batsman backs away outside leg, Tanvir follows him and beats the slog
short ball aimed at the badge of the helmet, Holder can't control a pull. He top-edges it in the air. Hasan Ali misjudges it. He runs in as opposed to staying back and sees the ball sail over him
Holder can't clear mid-off. Length ball outside off, Holder swings at the ball and miscues it to Hafeez
slider on middle, he gets forward and blocks
flipper that skids back in to cramp him for room, bunted to the off side
full and drifting into middle and leg, eased to mid-on to get off the mark
the ball drifted back in a long way from wide of the crease, turned to short fine leg
worked into the gap at midwicket with soft hands. The square leg fielder had a lot of work to do

hint of width, he rocks back and opens the bat face late to steer this between point and short third man. The distance between the advertising triangle and the hoarding is far too less. Rovman Powell smashes into the board and causes it much damage. Good to know he isn't hurt though.
full on middle, thumped to mid-off
touch ahead at length on middle, defended back down the pitch
worked with the angle to deep midwicket
drifts the length ball into the pads, worked to mid-on and scampers across for a single. Shehzad had to take evasive action quickly to avoid the throw
gets half-forward and defends the length ball to the off side
sliced between cover and point. Didn't get hold of it but he was hitting it towards the shorter boundary. That should get him going.
driven on the up to cover point
full and sliding into the pads, worked to square leg
steps out but Narine shortens his length. The ball cuts back in to hit his thigh pad. Shehzad played all around it
whipped from outside off to Pollard at wide long-on
width and he's smashed that into the point boundary. Too short as well, he picked the length early and put that away without much fuss
steered with an angled bat to short third man
drifting into middle and leg, tucked to square leg. Shehzad wanted the single, Kamran didn't
too full, flicked to Rovman at long-on
makes room to go over cover, but doesn't get to the pitch of the ball. Eased to point on the bounce
misfield at square leg gives away two extra runs. Got outside the line of the stumps to sweep that. The fielder dived over the ball
drilled down the ground but Badree dives full length to his right to pull off a one-handed stop
gift of a delivery. Full toss outside off, thumped straight to cover point
short of a length and outside off, Holder hits the deck hard and generates extra bounce, beats Shehzad's wild cut
whoa. Shot. Shehzad runs down the track. Shorter on off, he swats it imperiously to the midwicket boundary. Nobody moved

Holder hits back. Back of a length and outside off - kicks up and seams away - Shehzad is up on his tippy toes as he wafts at the ball loosely. He only feeds an outside edge to wicketkeeper Walton. Waist-high catch
short, angled in, bursts off the surface, homing in on the chest. Babar throws his bat in front of his chest and fends it off
hip-high short ball outside off, slower offcutter, Babar rocks back, picks it, and swats it away to the midwicket fence. That was stylish as well
banged in short and outside off, hops and quells to cover
Kamran ventures outside the leg stump for a sweep, this is full and fired down the leg side. Inside-edged fine past the keeper
Karam ventures outside leg again, another one darted down leg. Left alone
floated up on off, Kamran clears his front leg and hoists it over mid-off. Classy Is this 2005 all over again?
six and out. Kamran ventures outside leg, Badree follows the moving batsman with a dipping knee-high full-toss. Kamran can't control a slog-sweep and holes out to Lewis at deep midwicket
full and skidding in, Hafeez now attempts the sweep and is pinned on the pad, but this is clearly heading down leg
short slider on off, hurriedly chopped to cover
looped up on middle, much slower through the air, Haffeez stretches forward in defence
short on off, fends in in front of square and sets off
short and outside off, stands tall and punches a single to cover
back of a length and angled in on off stump, hangs back and turns a single through square leg
back of a length and outside off, a hint of extra bounce defeats the cut
length and outside off, presses forward, opens the bat-face and glides the ball to point
back of a length and outside off, Hafeez opens the face again, this time he secures a single wide of point. Third man mops up
looped up outside off, no turn, eases forward and caresses a drive through the covers
full and straight on middle, picked off to backward square leg
Hafeez goes low, rolls his wrists, and sweeps to long leg
quicker slider on off, defended on the front foot
fired on off, whipped away straight to square leg on the back foot
drifts in on off, nudged to square leg, pressing forward
short and outside off, leans back and guides to point
length ball outside off, run down to third man
hip-high short ball on off, swatted away to deep square

This is a skier. Both had ample time but neither called for the catch. Wicketkeeper Walton rams into the chest of his captain Brathwaite, who is thrown back by the impact. Man down now .Brathwaite, though, hung onto the overhead catch despite that nasty collision. Brathwaite is down. Banged in short and outside off, Hafeez is late onto the pull and top-edges it hiiiiigh into the sky. Drops down into the hands of Brathwaite. Walton gets an earful from an angry captain
back of a length and outside off, opens the face and pushes to point
back of a length, possibly a cutter, the batsman chips it in the air to the left of midwicket
back of a length and outside off, punched square through point
quicker offbreak on off, played back
hard-spinning offbreak, short in length, he goes back and blocks back to the bowler
this one goes the other away. Short and swerves away outside off, punched through cover
full and straight on middle, whisked away to the right of midwicket
short and kicks up outside off, Malik is equal to it. He leans back and late-cuts it away to the right of slip. Deftly done
back of a length and outside off, forced to mid-off
hip-high short ball outside off, Babar sits back and swats it straight to midwicket
sprayed very wide outside off, past the guideline, wide
short of a length and cuts back in, Babar slogs across the line and does not make contact. Williams' front foot strays. No-ball
the free-hit is a wide yorker, this is inside the guideline. Azam can't carve it through square. Beaten
just short of a good length on off, dinked to the right of the keeper
just short of a good length and outside off, stands tall and punches crisply to long-on
full, slower ball outside off, chipped through midwicket. They look for two and get three thanks to Badree's misfield
flat and outside off, eased through point
goes the other way. Back of a length and turns away outside off, punched through cover
tossed on off, presses forward and smothers it
short and outside off, punched away to the right of point
flighted length-ball, turns in, paddled fine
really full on off, Babar responds with a front-foot drive to long-on
full on off, driven smoothly, more work for long-on
short on off, hops and tucks it away between long leg and deep square leg
short on off, stands tall and punches the ball to midwicket
short on off, hits the splice of the bat. The ball rolls back
high short ball outside off, pulled away to the left of deep midwicket. Simmons looks to boot the ball back in and makes a mess of it. The ball rolls away to the boundary
back of a length on off, tip and run to cover
looks like a offcutter on off, worked to midwicket
just short of a good length and outside off, Malik arches his back and glides the ball down to short third man
wide of the crease, and angled in on off, but the length is full. Babar gets under it and lofts it to the right of Rovman at long-on. Rovman was left wrong-footed and the ball winds the race
glanced off the pads to long leg
slower cutter, drifts down leg, wide
short on leg stump, cramps the batsman for room, diverted down to long leg
hip-high short ball outside off, Malik swivels on the back foot and swats it away to deep midwicket
short and homing in on the chest, hops and fends it square on leg
shuffles across off, gets inside the line of a back of a length ball. Picks it up and pulls it beautifully over short fine leg
short and outside off, uses his wrists and swats it into the vacant spaces at midwicket. They hustle back for the second
length and outside off, steered to deep backward point
full and outside off, opens the face and square-drives wristily

slashed into the hands of short third man. Unlikely line, unlikely dismissal with both fine leg and third man in. But Azam hits it into the lap of Rovman. Very full and wide outside off, Babar throws his bat at the ball and skews it
Narine throws this one up outside off, the batsman gets forward, meets the pitch and drives to cover
full and outside off, driven down to long-on
late-cut away to third man
full on the stumps, driven down to long-on
length-ball offbreak on off, defended back to him on the back foot
short offbreak, allows Malik to move back and work the ball to midwicket
short on off, hops up and clips to mid-on
very full on off, push-driven to mid-on, where Holder fumbles and helps Pakistan's cause
back of a length and outside off, Malik sizes it up and clobbers it across the line. Puts it into the second tier beyond midwicket
really full on leg stump, flicked to long leg
short and outside, possibly a slower one, beats the pull
length and outside off, punchily driven to mid-off on the front foot
overpitched and outside off, Malik stretches forward, creams a drive through the covers and seals a six-wicket win for Pakistan. Their form guide in their last five T20Is: W W W W W under Sarfraz
